course_name: Medical Anthropology: Local and Global Perspectives
description: The course is intended to introduce students to the field of medical anthropology. It explores social, cultural and political dimensions of health and illness through an examination of topics such as biomedicine, inequalities and violence, the cultural meanings of health and illness, sexuality and sexual/reproductive health, relationships between patients and healers, global health and medical humanitarianism, the health of Indigenous peoples, mental health, transcultural psychiatry and more.
